  • Constructor Details

    • Stegosaur

      public Stegosaur()
      Instantiates a Stegosaur with and randomises its gender. It calls the Dinosaur class constructor which in turn calls the Actor class constructor. All Stegosaurs are represented by a 'd' and have 100 hit points.

  • Method Details

    • getAllowableActions

      public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actions getAllowableActions​(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor otherActor, java.lang.String direction, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map)
      Description copied from class: edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
      Returns a collection of the Actions that the otherActor can do to the current Actor.
      Overrides:
      getAllowableActions in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
      Parameters:
      otherActor - the Actor that might be performing attack
      direction - String representing the direction of the other Actor
      map - current GameMap
      Returns:
      A collection of Actions.

    • playTurn

      public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action playTurn​(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actions actions, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action lastAction, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Display display)
      Figure out what to do next. FIXME: Stegosaur wanders around at random, or if no suitable MoveActions are available, it just stands there. That's boring.
      Overrides:
      playTurn in class Dinosaur
      Parameters:
      actions - collection of possible Actions for this Actor
      lastAction - The Action this Actor took last turn. Can do interesting things in conjunction with Action.getNextAction()
      map - the map containing the Actor
      display - the I/O object to which messages may be written
      Returns:
      the Action to be performed
      See Also:
      Actor.playTurn(Actions, Action, GameMap, Display)
